meanings.definition: A unit of power equal to one joule per second.
meanings.sent1: A small light bulb uses one watt of power.
meanings.sent2: The lamp in the living room consumes fifty watts.
meanings.sent3: Why did the light bulb refuse to glow? It said, 'I'm tired of shining at one watt!'
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was like a thousand watts of energy, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the crowd cheering generated a wattage of excitement in the stadium.

meanings.definition: A unit of power in the International System of Units (SI) equal to one joule per second.
meanings.sent1: The microwave oven consumes 1200 watts of electricity.
meanings.sent2: The computer monitor requires at least 60 watts to operate efficiently.
meanings.sent3: Why did the toaster break up with the microwave? It said, 'You consume too many watts for me!'
meanings.sent4: His voice carried a wattage of authority that commanded attention.
meanings.sent5: The storm unleashed a powerful wattage of energy, causing widespread damage.

meanings.definition: The SI unit of power, equivalent to one joule per second.
meanings.sent1: Solar panels can generate several watts of electricity on a sunny day.
meanings.sent2: The wind turbine produces hundreds of watts of power in favorable conditions.
meanings.sent3: Why did the power outlet feel insecure? It said, 'I can't handle the responsibility of distributing all these watts!'
meanings.sent4: Her smile radiated a wattage of warmth that brightened everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's determination emitted a wattage of strength that inspired the team.
